popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning
Class FNPTask3

java.lang.Object
  popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning.FNPTask3
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, ThreadSpecificTaskObject
public class FNPTask3
extends java.lang.Object
implements ThreadSpecificTaskObject

class implements the CKK algorithm (Complete Karmarkar-Karp Algorithm) for 2-way Number Partitioning, due to Richard Korf (1997). This class is almost the same as FNPTask except that it implements the Thread-Local Object-Pool design pattern as a simple array for each thread acting as a stack, again without any need for synchronization; does not need any ReleaseFNPTaskObject, and also uses the DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3 class for dispatching and executing (non-comparable) tasks.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014-2015

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Method Detail

getId

public long getId()
returns the _myid data member, which is unique among all tasks that are actually submitted to the executor but not among all FNPTask3 objects.

Returns:

getThreadIdToRunOn

public int getThreadIdToRunOn()
return the id of the thread on which this object should execute. See specification details in interface parallel.ThreadSpecificTaskObject.

Specified by:
getThreadIdToRunOn in interface ThreadSpecificTaskObject
Returns:
int _threadid

run

public void run()
this is the method that the executor executes (implementing the run() method of the TaskObject interface that the class implements). It usually creates two more FNPTask3 objects, one corresponding to the decision to keep the two top numbers together, and the other to keep them apart. Then, the two new tasks have to be executed as well, recursively (but may well be submitted to the same executor, one of whose threads is currently executing this task.)

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

release

public void release()
indicate item is available for re-use by Object-Pool to which it belongs, and resets its "major" data IFF it is a managed object. Otherwise, it's a no-op.

newInstance

public static FNPTask3 newInstance(int n,
                                   int sz)
this factory method shall first try to obtain an object from the thread- local object pool of FNPTask3 objects, and if it can't find one, it will then produce an unmanaged one. The _descNumbers array will have length n, and the _sz member will be set to the 2nd arg.

Parameters:
n - int the _descNumbers array length
sz - int the upper bound of the array (usable size)
Returns:
FNPTask3

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Parameters:
args - String[]
